title: Business & Finance
text:
---

U.S. stocks rose, with the S&P 500 and Dow both gaining 0.7% to end the session at records, while the Nasdaq added 0.9%.

---

Copper prices climbed to records, fueled by bets on a U.S.-led global economic rebound that would boost demand for the metal.

---

Big food buyers including Walmart and Sysco are sparring with suppliers, fining them over infractions like late or incomplete orders.

---

China's big three telecom carriers lost their appeals against being kicked off the NYSE and will be delisted to comply with an investment ban introduced by Trump.

---

Edward Bramson 's Sherborne Investors said it sold its stake in Barclays , giving up on an activist campaign to restructure the bank.
